qas.question: In what are of architecture is neoclassical currently classed?
What is the term for sincere traditional-style architecture that sticks to regional architecture?
What is the award for major contributions to traditional of classical architecture in 21st century?
What is another name for New Classical Architecture?
What was neoclassicism classified under starting in the twentieth century?
What is new classical architecture also referred to as
What refers to architecture that uses a wide variety of materials and craftsmanship from different regions?
What is awarded to architects who contribute to 21st-century classical architecture?

context: As of the first decade of the 21st century, contemporary neoclassical architecture is usually classed under the umbrella term of <a0_0><b4_0>New Classical Architecture<a0_0/>.<b4_0/> Sometimes it is also referred to as <a3_0><b5_0>Neo-Historicism/Revivalism<b5_0/>, Traditionalism<a3_0/> or simply neoclassical architecture like the historical style. For sincere traditional-style architecture that sticks to regional architecture, materials and craftsmanship, the term <a1_0><b6_0>Traditional Architecture<b6_0/><a1_0/> (or vernacular) is mostly used. <a2_0><b7_0>The Driehaus Architecture Prize<b7_0/><a2_0/> is awarded to major contributors in the field of 21st century traditional or classical architecture, and comes with a prize money twice as high as that of the modernist Pritzker Prize.
